text: Wuhan Metro Line 11 () is a metro line in Wuhan. This line connects Wuchang with the eastern Optics Valley. ==History== {| class="wikitable" style="border-collapse: collapse; text-align: right;" !Segment!!Commencement!!Length!!Station(s)!!Name |- |style="text-align: left;"| Optics Valley Railway Station — Zuoling | 1 October 2018 | | 13 |style="text-align: left;"| Phase 1 |} ==Stations== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" | Station name ! rowspan="2" | Connections ! colspan="2" rowspan="2" | Distance ! rowspan="2" | Location |- ! ! |- style = "background:#; height: 2pt" | colspan = "6" | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | WCN | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | | | | |-bgcolor="lightgrey" | | | Wuhan BRT Optics Valley Tram via Xiongchu Avenue Station | | | |- | | | |0.000 |0.000 |rowspan="2"|Jiangxia |- | | | |1.468 |1.468 |- | | | |1.940 |3.408 |rowspan="1"|Jiangxia/Hongshan |- | | | |1.420 |4.828 |rowspan="4"|Hongshan |- | | | |1.075 |5.903 |- | | | |1.287 |7.190 |- | | | |0.926 |8.116 |- | | | |1.133 |9.249 |rowspan="1"|Jiangxia/Hongshan |- | | | |1.067 |10.316 |rowspan="3"|Jiangxia |- | | | |2.802 |13.118 |- | | | |2.153 |15.271 |- | | | |2.029 |17.300 |rowspan="2"|Hongshan |- | | | |1.444 |18.744 |-bgcolor="lightgrey" |Gedian South Railway Station | | | | |Huarong (Ezhou) |- style = "background:#; height: 2pt" | colspan = "6" | |} ==References== Category:Wuhan Metro Category:2018 establishments in China Category:Railway lines opened in 2018
